info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 6:36PM EDT until July 9 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Letcher, Blackey, Ice, Oscaloosa, Trailer, Dongola, Whitco, Day, Premium, Hot Spot, Marlowe, Van, Crown, Kings Creek, Bellcraft, Flint, Oven Fork, Roxana and Ermine.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING
